message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product. It's a high-quality item that has been highly valued by previous customers. I believe it would be a great addition to your collection. Given its exceptional value and features, I'm offering it to you for $120. I hope we can reach an agreement that benefits both of us.
Alice, I appreciate the offer, but $120 is a bit steep for me. Given my budget, I'm only able to offer $80 at this time. Let me know what you think.

Thank you for your prompt response, Bob. I understand your position and respect your offer. To try to find common ground, I am willing to meet you halfway. I propose to offer the product for $95 instead of $120. I believe this price reflects the value of the product while staying within your budget. I hope this proposal is acceptable to you.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, $95 is still a bit too high for me.  I'm confident that we can find a price that works for both of us.  I'm sticking to my original offer of $80.

I understand your position, Bob. In light of our ongoing discussion, I am prepared to offer the product at $90. This is a fair compromise considering the value of the product and your budget constraints. I hope this revised offer meets your expectations.
